This game is good but could be great. If you are forced to play rank, then balance the rank system. Within my first three days of playing I was a level 12 killer going against a rank 1 survivor (best in the game). The Level 1 has played for hundreds or thousands of hours. No compensation or reward for the obvious skill gap that you are forced to play. When people are forced to play ranked and rank is imbalanced why would they keep playing the game? The game also punishes you for doing well with one killer and if you are learning on another killer you are forced to play against much better players. If they fix this part of the game it could be worth buying but as for now save your money. i have played longer and the rank system has balanced out a little, but still not completely balanced.

Dead by Daylight used to be challenging and rewarding, but now it's just challenging and infuriating. They've removed pallets all over the map so now it's almost impossible on certain maps to outplay the killer. What is the point of the game if there's literally no outplay potential? Killers get a free pass and you get -10 minutes of your life.
lots of boobs

this is one of the best asymmetrical multiplayer games i've played, both playing as a survivor or a killer can be a lot of fun.

This game is specially fun if you play with friends and rotate whos the killer (5 players) but playing solo can also be fun if you get the right team as a survivor or if you find a fairly skilled survivor team if you're the killer.

PROS:
- Fun, every match can be different and thrilling.
- Every killer and survivor feel unique in their own way
- Quick matches makes it a great casual game or competitive if you go for it.
- There can be some really awesome moments where you feel like a ruthless killer or a really daring survivor, and those tend to happen every game.

CONS:
- Matchmaking is a bit weird and unfair.
- Theres a meta, and its not really a very fun one, if you're a survivor you know what to expect just as well as if you're a killer, and after a while its boring to deal with the same perks over and over.
- Some killers feel like as if they need reworks, the spirit, as an example, at the moment ive written this review is a very unfair killer, killing survivor teams in 5 minutes or less in some cases, which forces survivors to strive for that meta to avoid these unfair killers.
- Sometimes you can meet players that will be toxic or outright outplay you in a very unfair way, be prepared.

I've owned this game on Playstation for a couple years now and bought this on PC to play PTB's mainly. It's a great game and the developers are constantly improving it most recently with their graphical updates for the maps and character movement. However, from my experience on Playstation its stability isn't the best right now and I'm hoping that once the game has been completely remodelled that it will be a more stable game because it a game I enjoy playing!
COLGAME DE ESTA ASESINO PUTO

I thought I wasn't going to get addicted to it...

But I did...lmao.

In all seriousness, I love how this game has many challenges and new updates to keep you hooked. It also takes time to get the hang of it. and even when you get to high ranks you can somehow mess up. The variety of killers allows for many playstyles to be used (But you know, camping and Targeting are the most popular ones!) And same with survivors and all the perks you can get! (But........you know......then survivors turn into more of a menace/agony than the killer, it's almost as if the real monsters were the survivors all along sometimes....to put it lightly lmfao) It's a fun game!! although I have seen a few glitches in the game (And many hackers, which means that community control isn't really there...Remember BHVR has made a pretty good job so far guys!) But if you ignore all of that, the game is really fun if you don't feel frustrated lmao.

Anyways, ggs.

I love this game.
Even despite those few words, there's so many problems I also have with this game, and despite my clear enjoyment (290 hours please help) there's just too much going on that makes me not want to recommend it to new players. I'll do my best to explain my thoughts.

1. The Grind

The sheer amount of grinding this game has is insane. Over 20 different killers and survivors, which while giving the game good variety, gives this game an ungodly amount of grinding you have to do to get everything each character has to offer. Say you want to unlock all the perks from everyone, by going from level 1 to level 40. On average, especially later in the grind, it can take around 1 million bloodpoints just to get a character to level 40, already putting your grind at a whopping 40+ million bloodpoints, and given the rate at which you get them in matches, this (if it wasn't obvious by my playtime) can take what feels like forever. Given a perfect scenario, which in Dead by Daylight terms is every player bringing a 100% bonus bloodpoint offering, maxing out your stacks on one of two good bloodpoint perks (David's We're Gonna Live Forever for survivor or Leatherface's Barbeque and Chili for killer) AND a perfect score of 32k, you can get around 192k bloodpoints a match. If by some ungodly amount of luck or skill you can do this every match, you can unlock all the perks in just about 209 perfect matches, but since we're all imperfect (and since you often can't rely on randoms for those good offerings), we'd more likely have to settle for just getting around 20-40k a match. If given those terms, and with a rough average match time of 10-15 minutes (using with 12.5 for math's sake), you're looking at roughly a thousand or two matches, already totaling up to 200-400 hours of playtime, not counting game queue times. Good luck with that.

2. The Game and It's Company

Although it can often be a fun experience, there's many minor and sometimes major issues with the game that make it a much less fun experience especially during longer sessions. Many issues range from unusual hitboxes, laggy interactions, to game crashes and game-ruining glitches. While some issues on the ladder end are much more uncommon, they've caused major issues in one of the most recent updates, rendering the new map (Raccoon City Police Department) unplayable for many causing it to be taken off the roster. Given the very stale map rotation (haven't gotten a new map for about a year), this caused a lot of discourse and anger among the community. These types of issues have been plaguing the game for many years, where in some cases brand new killers (most notably The Twins) were riddled with so many bugs in their initial play test and release that they've remained some of the least played killers introduced. Not only does the game have issues, but the company that runs it causes a lot of them. In the past, the community has been incredibly vocal about issues in the game, but the majority of them don't get any attention paid to them, some even going on until they received public criticism for it (previous lack of Colorblind settings). This has gone so far to the point that players on Reddit have planned a boycott of the game's monetization system in order to protest against their poor level of maintenance. Although not everything was directly their fault or decision, they've still been behind a large amount of the things that people complain about.

One day, it's possible that Behavior will make more big strides in bringing the game to a point where the majority of the people are happy with it's current state. They've made effort into reaching that point, but sometimes they shoot their own foot in the process. Unfortunately, given the past and much more recent events, it seems bleak oftentimes. That being said;

I love this game. But damn, I hope it gets better.

It's fun. It gives you the experience of being in a horror film. The killers are scary and are nicely brought over from the movies and are very unique from each other. They should have more game modes though. The only game mode is repair the generators. You also rarely if ever get the maps that you bought in DLC. It typically cycles through the same

Ranking system:
Once I started caring about rank for the achievement, all the fun went away and it became too frustrating. The ranking system is horrible and broken. It de-ranks you whenever a play disconnects at the beginning of the match and causes the match to automatically end. You also have to do way too much work and tasks just to incrementally get closer to the next rank. You can repair most of the generators and still not rank up because you don't have enough points in other categories. Hours will be wasted just to go up one rank but it only takes 1 second to rank you back down. You can also get screwed over by OP killers in matches where it's really just out of your control. Just get rid of the ranking system altogether. It's not even needed in the game.

Great game, really fun game play that doesn't get old fast. Only draw back is the servers have a lot of issues especially when you are in the lobby where you are constantly getting disconnected from the host.

First of all ; 
Game is addictive. You will sit on your chair for hours. In the past 2 weeks of my purchase, I've sunk 118 hours and I will sink many more.

Pros : 
It's a 4 man's game.
It's mind numbing pure fun.
You get the adrenaline rush either as a survivor or a killer.
Cons :
People are toxic. 
What ever way you are playing, people will complain about how you do your stuff. You flashlight a killer, he will focus you down like you insulted his mama. You manage to 360 him or loop him around a while, better hope he will never catch you otherwise your sorry A** will be camped. 
As a killer; you get T-bagged, rapidly flashed in your face multiple time if you are not performing well. You don't camp, they BM you, you camp they BM you. You tunnel, they BM you. Every single move you are making, survivor will BM you. You win, they talk trash in chat and calls you names.

To be fair, despite the BM and toxicity of many player, the game is too good to be missed on.

Play to have fun and don't give a crap about the toxic players, if you can, make a team of 4 survivor's and enjoy the teamwork. It's very fun to take 3 flashlight and blind a killer who's about to pick up a dead survivor.

Wo soll ich nur Anfangen...?!
Eigentlich ein cooles Spiel, welches sehr viel Spaß machen kann. Wenn es da nicht die schlechte Community gäbe...

Wenn man als Killer spielen möchte, muss man hoffen, dass man in eine vernünftige Lobby kommt, wo Survs dich nicht anklickern, weil sie die Aufmerksamkeit, die sie von ihrer Mutti nicht bekommen, bei Fremden im Internet suchen.
Außerdem, wollen wohl viele der Survs im Wahren Leben gerne ihren Hintern hinhalten & weil sie dafür entweder zu hässlich oder zu Feige sind, präsentieren sie diesen auch gerne in Ausgängen oder hinter Paletten.

Die Survs Seite sieht auch nicht gerade rosiger aus. Entweder bekommt man totale Schrott Mates, die sich nur in Kellern verkriechen, weil sie wohl in Feuchten Dunklen Räumen an die Gebärmutter ihrer Mutter erinnert werden oder sie wurden von Mutti zum Essen gerufen & stehen AFK auf der Map rum. 
Die Killer haben auch eine Komische Art und Weise sich "Freunde" zu suchen. Weil sie Verlust Ängste haben, jagen sie zu 80% den gerade vom Haken geholten Survs hinterher oder sie bleiben, natürlich aus "Sicherheitsgründen" vor den Haken stehen & schauen einem Tief in die Augen. VOLL ROMANTISCH!! 

Den Entwickler ist das wohl der Community natürlich auch sehr wichtig. So sehr, dass sie anstelle von Bugs fixen lieber Skins für Echt Geld raus hauen. Der Spielspaß kommt bei denen erst an der tausendsten Stelle.
